abstract: General Electric agreed to pay a $50 million civil penalty to settle charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had misled investors with some fraudulent accounting in 2002 and 2003.
snippet: General Electric agreed to pay a $50 million civil penalty to settle charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had misled investors with some fraudulent accounting in 2002 and 2003.
lead_paragraph: General Electric agreed Tuesday to pay a $50 million civil penalty to settle charges that it had misled investors with some fraudulent accounting in 2002 and 2003.

headline.main: G.E. Pays $50 Million to Settle S.E.C. Suit
